title: List of dismissals and resignations in the first Trump administration
added: | Terminated without cause by the Trump Administration hours before acting Administrator [[John Barsa]] reached the maximum amount of time allowed to serve in that position without Senate confirmation under the [[Federal Vacancies Reform Act of 1998]].<ref>{{cite news |last1=Hansler |first1=Jennifer |first2=Kylie |last2=Atwood |date=November 7, 2020 |title=Second highest-ranking official at USAID ousted |url=https://edition.cnn.com/2020/11/06/politics/bonnie-glick-ousted-usaid/index.html |url-status=live |work=[[CNN]] |location= |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201107010125/https://edition.cnn.com/2020/11/06/politics/bonnie-glick-ousted-usaid/index.html |archive-date=November 7, 2020 |access-date=November 8, 2020}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |author=John D. McEntee II |date=November 6, 2020 |title=Bonnie Glick Termination Letter |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/context/bonnie-glick-termination-letter/1975f4af-2fca-4a6b-b97d-29a3d0e19f4c/ |url-status=live |work=[[The Washington Post]] |location= |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201107190700if_/https://www.washingtonpost.com/context/bonnie-glick-termination-letter/1975f4af-2fca-4a6b-b97d-29a3d0e19f4c/ |archive-date=November 7, 2020 |access-date=November 8, 2020}}</ref><ref name=BI-20201108-3-Agency-Heads />
